page.title: 03THE CHURCH
page.content: The church took two years to build and was finished in 1774.The stone that built the church was of course local stone.It was quarried and carted by horse to the burial ground.A new roof was built on to the vestry and the windows were repaired.A new stained glass window was erected in memory of John McPherson,who was Ardchonnell's School master. 35 grave stones now stand in the grave yard.The oldest grave stone was put there in 1333.The present church was the only church to be built on the site, and remains unchanged.The door has never been moved from its present position. Less people come to the church nowadays than in the old days.Only 10 people come to the church service nowadays.
